primary_trope.name: hidden_gem
primary_trope.hook_text: The best race you've never heard of.
primary_trope.mechanism: FOMO / loss aversion — the viewer is MISSING something. Losses feel 2.5x stronger than equivalent gains.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Gravel Medellín? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Gravel Medellín scored 53 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Gravel Medellín. Medellín, Colombia. 75 mi. Colombian mountain gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Adventure. 4 out of 5. The kind of ride you'll tell stories about. Experience. 4 out of 5. Genuinely unique. Hard to replicate. Racing gravel in the transformed city once "associated with conflict and cartels" now positioned as "hub of innovation, culture, and urban development" creates compelling narrative. Length. 3 out of 5. Long enough to matter. Short enough to recover. 120km hits the sweet spot for most riders—long enough to matter, manageable enough to finish strong. Technicality. 3 out of 5. The course bites if you stop paying attention. Described as moderate terrain with rolling short steep hills and sustained climbs rather than technical rock gardens. Elevation. 3 out of 5. The hills sort the trained from the untrained. 7,500 feet of climbing over 75 miles creates substantial suffering without being soul-crushing. Climate. 3 out of 5. Variable. Bring layers and a flexible attitude. August racing in Medellín means the "City of Eternal Spring" delivers mild year-round temperatures of 18-28°C thanks to Andean elevation. Altitude. 3 out of 5. You'll feel it on the climbs. Starting at approximately 1,495m above sea level with climbs pushing higher into thin air territory around 2,500m elevation. Community. 3 out of 5. Good vibes. Riders actually talk to each other. Colombia's cycling culture runs deeper than most destinations, with the region described as "filled with brightly colored towns and enchanting landscapes" perfect for bike discovery.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The remaining six. Quick-fire. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Regional reputation. The locals know. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Adequate. Room for improvement. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Small but scrappy field. Logistics. 1 out of 5. Good luck finding anything out there. Expenses. 1 out of 5. Budget-friendly. Your bank account barely notices.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Colombian Mountain Gravel. If you have a big budget and want a Colombian experience. maybe. For most riders. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.narration: If Gravel Medellín isn't quite right for you. For better value: regional gravel races. For similar Colombian terrain: Gravel Bogotá.
